channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.description:
Report X-2023100450

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: PACKAGE CONTENTS INSPECTED DUE TO OUTER BOX FEELING COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION FOUND APPROXIMATELY TWO POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING FROZEN MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED.

item.title: Report X-2023100421
item.description:
Report X-2023100421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-27
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A CALL WAS PLACED TO THE PACKAGE SERVICE CENTER. A PACKAGE WAS FOUND IN THE WEST SORT AISLE. IT WAS SAID TO BE VIBRATING WHEN FOUND. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER (DR) WAS THEN DISPATCHED TO RETREIVE THE PACKAGE. UPON RETRIEVAL AND OPENING OF THE PACKAGE IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE WAS NOT PROPERLY DECLARED AS A HAZARDOUS MATERIAL. A CALL WAS THEN MADE TO HELP DESK.

item.title: Report X-2023100016
item.description:
Report X-2023100016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 09/13/2023 at approximately 1815, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4553408 at the station location in Portland, reporting an undeclared corrosive spill. Spillage was detected from two separate shipments, each consisting of two plastic bottles, packageed sideways, in one fiberboard box. Due to an insecure closure, one jug from each box leaked, resulting a spillage. Per an online safety data sheet, these shipments are classified as UN1824 Sodium Hydroxide Solution. Neither package adorned were marked or labeled as dangerous goods, nor did either package have the required paperwork and appropriate packaging, in accordance with IATA regulations. Both shipments are being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023100236
item.description:
Report X-2023100236

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-07T18:15:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-25
  • City: TROUTDALE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered leaking and removed from sortation, then brought to QA. DescribePack: Both caps were loose. Package had been repacked at station 972, and original hazardous labels were left out. Bottles were packed sideways in the box and leaking from the caps. SPIDR images show original packaging had Limited Quantity diamond. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a spill bin and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023090843
item.description:
Report X-2023090843

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-06T09:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-05
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PRELOADER WAS LOADING PACKAGE AND HEARD AEROSOL CANS RATTLING IN THE BOX WITH NO MARKINGS. THEY DID NOT OPEN THE BOX, BUT BROUGHT TO PSC FOR INVESTIGATION. RMP OPENED BOX AND DISCOVERED FOUR AEROSOL CANS WITH NO ORIGINAL LABELING DENOTING CONTENTS. RMP CALLED HMSC TO REPORT UNDECLARED SHIPMENT. SUBMITTING PACKAGE INTO ETT FOR REGULATORY COMPLIANCE REVIEW.
